entry.title: Everybot Championship Grant Awarded
entry.summary: The Robonauts Everybot Championship Grant powered by S&K Technologies has been awarded to FRC Team 9668 West Robotics from Knoxville, Tennessee.
entry.content: The Robonauts Everybot Championship Grant powered by S&K Technologies has been awarded to FRC Team 9668 West Robotics from Knoxville, Tennessee.

entry.title: Major Item Left off the BOM (hex shaft)
entry.summary: 1/2" hex shaft is needed for both the climber and roller claw was left of the bill of materials due to an oversight on our parts. Links to purchase hex shaft can be found in the bill of materials now. Please note that rounded 1/2" hex shaft also works, allowing the hex shaft to fit into 13.75mm bearings.
entry.content: 1/2" hex shaft is needed for both the climber and roller claw was left of the bill of materials due to an oversight on our parts. Links to purchase hex shaft can be found in the bill of materials now. Please note that rounded 1/2" hex shaft also works, allowing the hex shaft to fit into 13.75mm bearings.

entry.title: The Robonauts Everybot Championship Grant powered by S&K Technologies
entry.summary: The Robonauts are excited to announce that for the 2024 season S&K Technologies will be funding a grant covering FIRST Championship registration fees for a qualified team using an Everybot or “Everybot-inspired”* mechanism. More information on the grant can be found here.
entry.content: The Robonauts are excited to announce that for the 2024 season S&K Technologies will be funding a grant covering FIRST Championship registration fees for a qualified team using an Everybot or “Everybot-inspired”* mechanism. More information on the grant can be found here.

entry.title: Spark Max Motor Controller out of stock
entry.summary: As of 1/31 the Spark Max motor controller is currently out of stock from REV with a restock expected in late February. If you are in need of motor controllers the best and most affordable replacement is the Victor SPX from VEXpro, which can only be used with brushed motor controllers. This will work with all recommended motors on the Everybot except the NEO on the climber.
entry.content:
As of 1/31 the Spark Max motor controller is currently out of stock from REV with a restock expected in late February. If you are in need of motor controllers the best and most affordable replacement is the Victor SPX from VEXpro, which can only be used with brushed motor controllers. This will work with all recommended motors on the Everybot except the NEO on the climber.


To use the motor Victor SPX you will need Phoenix Tuner, here is the current link for newest phoenix offline install. If that does not properly install try this link instead. These install come form CTRE's github, for more documentation see this.
